inclusion.criterion: TSH in the ideal reference range (0.4-4.0 milli-international units per liter (mIU/L))
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Planned thyroidectomy for nodular thyroid disease or low-risk differentiated thyroid cancer (<4cm, no ETE, no expected use of RAI or suppressive levothyroxine therapy)
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: History of psychiatric illness (major illness as defined by DSM IV: major depression, schizophrenia, mania, etc). Patients prescribed chronic medications for psychiatric illness, those taking benzodiazepines or anti-seizure medication.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Estrogen therapy that is new within the last 6 weeks or if the dose has been changed within the last 6 weeks
exclusion.label: not_met
met
exclusion.evidence: lab results: anti-TPO levels were extremely high (120 IU/ml)

exclusion.criterion: Chronic use (>4 weeks) of concomitant medications that could affect cognition and memory (including sedative hypnotics, selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors, selective serotonin-norepinephrine reuptake inhibitors, Topamax, benzodiazepines, etc.)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Persistent cancer of any type or other major medical illness
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has Hashimoto's thyroiditis, but symptoms improved with Levothyroxine treatment. She is still overweight and has high anti-TPO levels.
